name: Auto-translate Documentation
description: Automatically translates README and docs files to multiple languages when saved
prompt:
Translate {{filePath}} to French (fr), Hebrew (he), Italian (it), Japanese (ja), Portuguese (pt), and Chinese (zh). CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS: 1. HEBREW RTL: Wrap entire Hebrew document in
at start and
at end. IMPORTANT: Wrap each code block (```...```) in
...
so code displays left-to-right. 2. LANGUAGE BADGES: Add at top (after RTL div for Hebrew): [![en](https://img.shields.io/badge/lang-en-gray.svg)](../../../README.md) [![pt](https://img.shields.io/badge/lang-pt-gray.svg)](../pt/README.md) [![fr](https://img.shields.io/badge/lang-fr-gray.svg)](../fr/README.md) [![it](https://img.shields.io/badge/lang-it-gray.svg)](../it/README.md) [![ja](https://img.shields.io/badge/lang-ja-gray.svg)](../ja/README.md) [![zh](https://img.shields.io/badge/lang-zh-gray.svg)](../zh/README.md) [![he](https://img.shields.io/badge/lang-he-gray.svg)](../he/README.md) Replace current language badge with brightgreen and style=for-the-badge (e.g., for French: [![fr](https://img.shields.io/badge/lang-fr-brightgreen.svg?style=for-the-badge)](../fr/README.md)) 3. PRESERVE STRUCTURE: Same headers, code blocks, emojis, tables, lists, horizontal rules. 4. DO NOT TRANSLATE: Code blocks, commands (smus-cli, git, pip), file names, URLs, AWS services (SageMaker, Glue, Athena, DataZone, S3), technical terms (CLI, CI/CD, DevOps, workflow, pipeline, bundle, manifest). 5. TRANSLATION STYLE - AVOID LANGUAGE MIXING: - If a sentence has multiple English technical terms, keep the ENTIRE sentence in English and add translation in parentheses - Example: "Deploy Airflow DAGs, Jupyter notebooks, and ML workflows" → Keep in English, add: (פרוס DAGs של Airflow, מחברות Jupyter, וזרימות עבודה של ML) - Only translate sentences that are purely descriptive with minimal technical terms - For technical phrases, keep in English and add native language explanation in parentheses when helpful - Avoid switching languages mid-sentence - it's hard to read 6. TRANSLATE: Only purely descriptive text with minimal technical terms. Section headings can stay in English if they're technical. 7. SAVE TO: docs/langs/{language-code}/{{fileName}} (maintain subdirectory structure). 8. QUALITY CHECK: Verify header count, code block count, emojis, and links match source.
